word_mean: 狂犬病，咬病：从蝙蝠直至牛等哺乳动物均可罹患的一种通常致命的急性中枢神经系统传染病，由弹状病毒属(rhabdoviridae)的一种RNA病毒引起。人感染本病系患狂犬病的蝙蝠、狼、狗、猫、或其它哺乳动物咬所致。本病在人的潜伏期为1至3个月，咬处距脑近者比距脑远者的潜伏期为短。最早的症状是感染处周围有麻木和麻刺感，不久便出现全身兴奋性增高，随之发热，吞咽肌瘫痪和声门痉挛(最初由饮水，看见水或躁狂行为激起)。惊厥、肢体搐搦和呼吸麻痹是本病终末期的必然表现。本病的诊断在生前可由唾液、脑脊液、尿液中分离出病毒
疯犬咬伤后引起的，以烦躁，怕风，恐水，畏光，痉挛抽搐，终致瘫痪而危及生命为主要表现的疾病。

sentence.Network_en: His dogs were inoculated against rabies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的狗注射过狂犬疫苗。

sentence.Network_en: The identification of rabies virus has saved many lives.
sentence.Network_cn: 狂犬病病毒的确认挽救了许多人的性命.

sentence.Network_en: Dogs, cats and bats can all carry rabies.
sentence.Network_cn: 狗 、 猫和蝙蝠都可能携带狂犬病病毒.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin, from rabere 'rave'

entry.def: Rabies is a serious disease which causes people and animals to go mad and die. Rabies is particularly common in dogs.

means.word_mean: 1. an acute viral disease of the nervous system of warm-blooded animals (usually transmitted by the bite of a rabid animal); rabies is fatal if the virus reaches the brain

auth_sentence.content: Indeed, there is really only one: the rabies virus.

auth_sentence.content: For now, Giese remains the gold standard for recovery from rabies.

auth_sentence.content: Westerners don't have much cause to fear death from rabies these days.
